GT.content: interruption opens space of absolute heterogeneity—infinite secret

R.content: democracy opens public space by granting change of tone (Weschsel der Töne), irony as well as fiction, simulacrum, secret, literature > this undecidability [“I continue to believe”] only radical possibility of letting/thinking what comes about by arriving of whoever arrives
R.linkedContent: democracy opens public space by granting change of tone (Weschsel der Töne), irony as well as fiction, simulacrum, secret, literature > this undecidability [“I continue to believe”] only radical possibility of letting/thinking what comes about by arriving of whoever arrives

FL.content: rigorously distinguish “to-come” from future, which loses openness, loses coming of other, w/out which there’s no justice, la justice reste à venir, elle a à venir, elle est à-venir
FL.linkedContent: rigorously distinguish “to-come” from future, which loses openness, loses coming of other, w/out which there’s no justice, la justice reste à venir, elle a à venir, elle est à-venir

FL.content: madness of justice: the incalculable and giving idea of justice is close to the bad, the worst, can always be reappropriated by the most perverse calculation > assurance against the worst will only suture the opening
FL.linkedContent: madness of justice: the incalculable and giving idea of justice is close to the bad, the worst, can always be reappropriated by the most perverse calculation > assurance against the worst will only suture the opening

OOG.content: for Husserl, “horizon is always virtually present in every experience; for it is at once the unity and incompletion, the anticipated unity in every incompletion” > keeps infinite openness in tact, converting critical philosophy’s state of possibility into concrete infinite potentiality
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, “horizon is always virtually present in every experience; for it is at once the unity and incompletion, the anticipated unity in every incompletion” > keeps infinite openness in tact, converting critical philosophy’s state of possibility into concrete infinite potentiality

OOG.content: spirit’s radical freedom: theoretical attitude (which the philosopher inaugurates), opens horizon of knowledge as a pre-having beyond finitude
OOG.linkedContent: spirit’s radical freedom: theoretical attitude (which the philosopher inaugurates), opens horizon of knowledge as a pre-having beyond finitude

SPOM.content: injunction, pledge, “necessary” promise “il faut l’avenir” marks any opening to the event and conditions interest (not indifference) to anything whatsoever, to all content, no desire w/out it
SPOM.linkedContent: injunction, pledge, “necessary” promise “il faut l’avenir” marks any opening to the event and conditions interest (not indifference) to anything whatsoever, to all content, no desire w/out it

HERP.content: philein—to accord oneself to logos (Sprache, legein, which is already engaged, opened), co-respond, correspondence (not first w/ some subject)
HERP.linkedContent: philein—to accord oneself to logos (Sprache, legein, which is already engaged, opened), co-respond, correspondence (not first w/ some subject)

HERP.content: via Heidegger, opening of 2 maintains the entre-deux, no community gathering (pas de rassemblement communautaire) if there are not 2, but no 2 w/out opposition (Gegensatz)
HERP.linkedContent: via Heidegger, opening of 2 maintains the entre-deux, no community gathering (pas de rassemblement communautaire) if there are not 2, but no 2 w/out opposition (Gegensatz)

HERP.content: Heidegger [on Bildung]: community of struggle (Kampfgemeinschaft) a struggle that holds opposition open, permits resolute self-examination [only the “few”] [see p. 190]
HERP.linkedContent: Heidegger [on Bildung]: community of struggle (Kampfgemeinschaft) a struggle that holds opposition open, permits resolute self-examination [only the “few”] [see p. 190]

POOF.content: wound opens w/ necessity to count one’s friends, democracy’s 2 irreducible laws: 1) respect for irreducible singularity or alterity 2) calculation of majorities, representable subjects, all equal
POOF.linkedContent: wound opens w/ necessity to count one’s friends, democracy’s 2 irreducible laws: 1) respect for irreducible singularity or alterity 2) calculation of majorities, representable subjects, all equal

POOF.content: mais là où tout autre est également tout autre > political desire borne by this disjunction, bears chance of future of democracy, divided virtue, inadequate to itself, chaos opening in silence
POOF.linkedContent: mais là où tout autre est également tout autre > political desire borne by this disjunction, bears chance of future of democracy, divided virtue, inadequate to itself, chaos opening in silence

POOF.content: no virtue, w/out the tragedy of # w/out #, perhaps more unthinkable than tragedy
POOF.linkedContent: no virtue, w/out the tragedy of # w/out #, perhaps more unthinkable than tragedy

POOF.content: Nietzsche’s hospitality for mad arrivants, fool already on premises, a guest who would have preceded his host, sheer madness of inverting friend/enemy > requests only that they open the doors of their hearts to him
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s hospitality for mad arrivants, fool already on premises, a guest who would have preceded his host, sheer madness of inverting friend/enemy > requests only that they open the doors of their hearts to him

POOF.content: via Heidegger, philía as opening, accord, in essential relation w/ phúsis as covering up, dissimulation of self > phúsis qua philía: l’une, comme l’autre, garde ce rapport à la fois généreux et jaloux à elle-même—elle aime à se cacher, krúptesthai phileîn > le retrait de la pudeur [decency] donne ici le mouvement même: gives the gift (donne le don), accords phúsis and philía
POOF.linkedContent: via Heidegger, philía as opening, accord, in essential relation w/ phúsis as covering up, dissimulation of self > phúsis qua philía: l’une, comme l’autre, garde ce rapport à la fois généreux et jaloux à elle-même—elle aime à se cacher, krúptesthai phileîn > le retrait de la pudeur [decency] donne ici le mouvement même: gives the gift (donne le don), accords phúsis and philía

HASD.content: to doubt divine promise, transgress the injunction [of hyperessential, negative theological God], would be to see an opening (closing in on itself) of literariness, lawless law of fiction
HASD.linkedContent: to doubt divine promise, transgress the injunction [of hyperessential, negative theological God], would be to see an opening (closing in on itself) of literariness, lawless law of fiction

VM.content: Levinas’ messianic eschatology never directly mentioned, an opening of opening, beyond all category, concepts, resists philosophemes, space or hollow in naked experience
VM.linkedContent: Levinas’ messianic eschatology never directly mentioned, an opening of opening, beyond all category, concepts, resists philosophemes, space or hollow in naked experience

OH.content: responsibility: making a chance of the memory of a name, of the idiomatic limit > an opening of identity to its future
OH.linkedContent: responsibility: making a chance of the memory of a name, of the idiomatic limit > an opening of identity to its future

PAS.content: the other of language: the maddest referential opening

FSW.content: differance, pre-opening of ontic-ontological distinction, & of all the differences which furrow (sillonnant) Freudian conceptuality
FSW.linkedContent: differance, pre-opening of ontic-ontological distinction, & of all the differences which furrow (sillonnant) Freudian conceptuality

SH.content: figure of absolute future: monstrosity—Elijah, guest, other [re: word to be circumcised opened like a door to “who” would come] like a wound? yes and no [cf. F p. xiv]
SH.linkedContent: figure of absolute future: monstrosity—Elijah, guest, other [re: word to be circumcised opened like a door to “who” would come] like a wound? yes and no [cf. F p. xiv]

WM.content: since, for Aristotle, mimēsis is not identity but gives us to see in action what is not to be seen in action, only in its resembling double, its mimēma, Derrida wants to leave open this energetic absence, this enigmatic division, the interval which makes scenes and tells tales
WM.linkedContent: since, for Aristotle, mimēsis is not identity but gives us to see in action what is not to be seen in action, only in its resembling double, its mimēma, Derrida wants to leave open this energetic absence, this enigmatic division, the interval which makes scenes and tells tales

DS.content: relation of one text to another, open & closed, at the same time > necessary that each organism only refer to itself as determinate
DS.linkedContent: relation of one text to another, open & closed, at the same time > necessary that each organism only refer to itself as determinate

DS.content: out of sight (a perte de vue): hymen & dissemination > une entaille y est marquée, qui ouvre encore sur un autre texte et pratique une autre lecture, l’analyse en serait infinie
DS.linkedContent: out of sight (a perte de vue): hymen & dissemination > une entaille y est marquée, qui ouvre encore sur un autre texte et pratique une autre lecture, l’analyse en serait infinie

DS.content: surprise in writing, supplement, baffling economy of seduction: entre… un silence
DS.linkedContent: surprise in writing, supplement, baffling economy of seduction: entre… un silence

DS.content: supplement in Mallarmé (not unilateral movement, like in Rousseau, which loses warmth of spoken word): c’est l’excès d’un signifiant qui, en son dedans, supplée l’espace et répète l’ouverture
DS.linkedContent: supplement in Mallarmé (not unilateral movement, like in Rousseau, which loses warmth of spoken word): c’est l’excès d’un signifiant qui, en son dedans, supplée l’espace et répète l’ouverture

GSP.content: is Husserl respectful of that which remains open w/in structure, even when one thinks the opening of structure as structural? [faithful comprehension meets no choice]
GSP.linkedContent: is Husserl respectful of that which remains open w/in structure, even when one thinks the opening of structure as structural? [faithful comprehension meets no choice]

GSP.content: unlike noema, hylē is real but not intentional, sensate material of affect before intentional form, pure passivity, w/out which consciousness could not receive anything but itself, an essential opening > as temporal matter, wouldn’t it be possibility of genesis itself? irreducible complicity of time/other call “principle of principle” into question
GSP.linkedContent: unlike noema, hylē is real but not intentional, sensate material of affect before intentional form, pure passivity, w/out which consciousness could not receive anything but itself, an essential opening > as temporal matter, wouldn’t it be possibility of genesis itself? irreducible complicity of time/other call “principle of principle” into question

PS.content: for Artaud, organ is place of loss: its center always an orifice, always functions as embouchure
PS.linkedContent: for Artaud, organ is place of loss: its center always an orifice, always functions as embouchure

FS.content: structuralist totality promises infidelity to telos, but: structures must permit totality to open, overflow itself, totality thus takes on meaning by anticipating telos > an opening which liberates genesis and time but risks stifling force under futural becoming of teleological form
FS.linkedContent: structuralist totality promises infidelity to telos, but: structures must permit totality to open, overflow itself, totality thus takes on meaning by anticipating telos > an opening which liberates genesis and time but risks stifling force under futural becoming of teleological form

TB.content: Benjamin uses metaphor of amphora, ammetaphor, to describe contact btwn languages; metamphora adjoins along broken line (not infinite/straight line): Derrida compares to Heidegger, Rilke, Hölderlin’s urn (re: word/thing) > amphora is one w/ itself while its openness forbids its totality, always giving/receiving [open square]
TB.linkedContent: Benjamin uses metaphor of amphora, ammetaphor, to describe contact btwn languages; metamphora adjoins along broken line (not infinite/straight line): Derrida compares to Heidegger, Rilke, Hölderlin’s urn (re: word/thing) > amphora is one w/ itself while its openness forbids its totality, always giving/receiving [open square]

RGE.content: in doubling lordship (la maîtrise), sovereignty doesn’t remove itself from dialectics or its synthesis like an independent morsel (une pièce) > such an abstract negation would consolidate ontologics > sovereignty not simply a caesura or interruption but an opening, irruption: sovereignty inscribes dialectical synthesis, provides economy of reason w/ its unlimiting boundaries of non-sense, makes it function in sacrifice of meaning (du sens)
RGE.linkedContent: in doubling lordship (la maîtrise), sovereignty doesn’t remove itself from dialectics or its synthesis like an independent morsel (une pièce) > such an abstract negation would consolidate ontologics > sovereignty not simply a caesura or interruption but an opening, irruption: sovereignty inscribes dialectical synthesis, provides economy of reason w/ its unlimiting boundaries of non-sense, makes it function in sacrifice of meaning (du sens)

REST.content: when shoes no longer have strict relation avec un sujet porteur ou porté—they’re the lightened, anonymous, voided support (but so much the heavier abandoned à son inertie opaque) “of an absent subject whose name haunts the open form”
REST.linkedContent: when shoes no longer have strict relation avec un sujet porteur ou porté—they’re the lightened, anonymous, voided support (but so much the heavier abandoned à son inertie opaque) “of an absent subject whose name haunts the open form”

REST.content: never completely open, the shoe maintains a form, that of the foot > describes external surface or envelope of what is called a “form” [Derrida quotes from Littré, where “form” is wood in shape (figure) of foot, then he links figure to face—Shapiro sees Van Gogh’s in “his” shoes]
REST.linkedContent: never completely open, the shoe maintains a form, that of the foot > describes external surface or envelope of what is called a “form” [Derrida quotes from Littré, where “form” is wood in shape (figure) of foot, then he links figure to face—Shapiro sees Van Gogh’s in “his” shoes]

PIO.content: status of invention via politics of patent, programming of patented inventions (even integrating margin of chance)—are programmed inventions still inventions? still open to future?
PIO.linkedContent: status of invention via politics of patent, programming of patented inventions (even integrating margin of chance)—are programmed inventions still inventions? still open to future?

PIO.content: other as the uninvented, in invention, must let other come, not make the other: deconstructive invention as opening, uncloseting, destabilizing foreclusionary structures
PIO.linkedContent: other as the uninvented, in invention, must let other come, not make the other: deconstructive invention as opening, uncloseting, destabilizing foreclusionary structures

TR.content: cut: wounding, opening, chance of a respiration

AFR.content: Condillac replaces a metaphysics of essences/causes (the hidden) w/ metaphysics of phenomena & relation (the open)
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac replaces a metaphysics of essences/causes (the hidden) w/ metaphysics of phenomena & relation (the open)

AFR.content: for Condillac, time secures moment when object goes missing from perception, moment perception is absent from itself > moment space of signs opens, w/ function of imagination [time as that which absents perception?]
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, time secures moment when object goes missing from perception, moment perception is absent from itself > moment space of signs opens, w/ function of imagination [time as that which absents perception?]

D.content: by a folding-back (reploiement) or internal angle of surface: face (frons scaenae) contemplates itself as unconditioned opening of appearance, but explains itself as surface-effect, as conditioned [by square apparatus]
D.linkedContent: by a folding-back (reploiement) or internal angle of surface: face (frons scaenae) contemplates itself as unconditioned opening of appearance, but explains itself as surface-effect, as conditioned [by square apparatus]

D.content: knife, obsessive, phallus that threatens & is threatened, la menace du coupe-papier dont saigna la tranche rouge ouvre ou érige (which the red edge bled opens or erects), thus broaching/breaching (entamant) in a stroke (d’un trait) the decision: opens mouth > operation of reading/writing
D.linkedContent: knife, obsessive, phallus that threatens & is threatened, la menace du coupe-papier dont saigna la tranche rouge ouvre ou érige (which the red edge bled opens or erects), thus broaching/breaching (entamant) in a stroke (d’un trait) the decision: opens mouth > operation of reading/writing

D.content: the opening, as presence, is not noticed as opening—we’re fascinated, glued to what presents itself: we’re unable to see presence as such, visibility of visible > never present themselves
D.linkedContent: the opening, as presence, is not noticed as opening—we’re fascinated, glued to what presents itself: we’re unable to see presence as such, visibility of visible > never present themselves

D.content: opening paradoxically wrought as a thing that closes (squares of cubes)
D.linkedContent: opening paradoxically wrought as a thing that closes (squares of cubes)

D.content: limits of square/cube—indefinitely specular unfolding/refolding: not limits at all > opening of its own inscription—tout autre, la même, another geometry to come [EROS]
D.linkedContent: limits of square/cube—indefinitely specular unfolding/refolding: not limits at all > opening of its own inscription—tout autre, la même, another geometry to come [EROS]

PPT.content: trait never appears, never itself—contracts in its retreat? marks the difference of form/content of the appearing
PPT.linkedContent: trait never appears, never itself—contracts in its retreat? marks the difference of form/content of the appearing

PPT.content: l’entame of the origin: opens, w/ trace, w/out initiating anything
PPT.linkedContent: l’entame of the origin: opens, w/ trace, w/out initiating anything

LI.content: that trace de-limits what it limits is why the finiteness of a context has an indefinite opening—never secure, simple > in this openness of erasure: political responsibility (where irreducible violence communicates w/ an essential nonviolence) > only the irresponsible (to be polemical) will object, those for whom things are always calculable, clear, programmable, decipherable
LI.linkedContent: that trace de-limits what it limits is why the finiteness of a context has an indefinite opening—never secure, simple > in this openness of erasure: political responsibility (where irreducible violence communicates w/ an essential nonviolence) > only the irresponsible (to be polemical) will object, those for whom things are always calculable, clear, programmable, decipherable

LI.content: unconditionality independent of every determinate context, even determination of context as such > announces itself only in opening of context
LI.linkedContent: unconditionality independent of every determinate context, even determination of context as such > announces itself only in opening of context

LI.content: though nothing exists outside context, limit of frame/border of context always entails nonclosure: outside penetrates, thus determines, inside
LI.linkedContent: though nothing exists outside context, limit of frame/border of context always entails nonclosure: outside penetrates, thus determines, inside

TN.content: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth

TN.content: how could [Husserl’s] identical coincidence open up to anything else?
TN.linkedContent: how could [Husserl’s] identical coincidence open up to anything else?

TN.content: “cet espacement fait l’épreuve du non-contact comme la condition ou l’expérience même du contact, l’expérience même du même à jamais ouverte (forever open)—et par l’autre espacée” [hiatus of noncontact at heart of contact]
TN.linkedContent: “cet espacement fait l’épreuve du non-contact comme la condition ou l’expérience même du contact, l’expérience même du même à jamais ouverte (forever open)—et par l’autre espacée” [hiatus of noncontact at heart of contact]

TN.content: for there to be a good heart: possibility of bad heart must remain forever open, i.e. tout autre > good heart must be ready for the other, for treachery, for perjury (inevitable-impossible vow of abstinence, tactile’s fate); is this how we can translate Kant’s “evil heart”?
TN.linkedContent: for there to be a good heart: possibility of bad heart must remain forever open, i.e. tout autre > good heart must be ready for the other, for treachery, for perjury (inevitable-impossible vow of abstinence, tactile’s fate); is this how we can translate Kant’s “evil heart”?

NOY.content: when thought and the word (la parole) given in writing merge (se confond) at the heart of the same time (au coeur du même temps); chance encounter in singularity of “graph,” coincidence of the cut (la coupure) and the opening (l’ouverture)
NOY.linkedContent: when thought and the word (la parole) given in writing merge (se confond) at the heart of the same time (au coeur du même temps); chance encounter in singularity of “graph,” coincidence of the cut (la coupure) and the opening (l’ouverture)

ATM.content: opening of interruption is never pure

E.content: analogy of God and poet proceeds from and returns to logos, source as mouth and outlet (embouchure)
E.linkedContent: analogy of God and poet proceeds from and returns to logos, source as mouth and outlet (embouchure)

AD.content: Levinas’ open door calls for the opening of an exteriority or of a transcendence of the idea of infinity > idea comes through the door: the door passed through is reason in teaching
AD.linkedContent: Levinas’ open door calls for the opening of an exteriority or of a transcendence of the idea of infinity > idea comes through the door: the door passed through is reason in teaching

AD.content: discretion of face, not unveiling/revelation but an opening before the opening, not an opening to phenomenality, not Heidegger’s Erschliessung, Erschlossenheit, Offenheit
AD.linkedContent: discretion of face, not unveiling/revelation but an opening before the opening, not an opening to phenomenality, not Heidegger’s Erschliessung, Erschlossenheit, Offenheit

LG.content: all texts left open, eternally remarkable—possibility of becoming literature
LG.linkedContent: all texts left open, eternally remarkable—possibility of becoming literature

OG.content: we can merely glimpse the closure, not the end, of a historico-metaphysical epoch (3000 years) whose ouverture de champ produces its own dislocation, denounces its own limits
OG.linkedContent: we can merely glimpse the closure, not the end, of a historico-metaphysical epoch (3000 years) whose ouverture de champ produces its own dislocation, denounces its own limits

OG.content: arche-writing at work in graphic and nongraphic expression, pattern uniting form & substance, all content & expression > opens temporalization, relationship w/ other & language
OG.linkedContent: arche-writing at work in graphic and nongraphic expression, pattern uniting form & substance, all content & expression > opens temporalization, relationship w/ other & language

OG.content: arche-writing: nonethical (violent) opening of ethics, origin of morality & immorality; no ethics w/out other, detour, simulation, differance, absence, writing
OG.linkedContent: arche-writing: nonethical (violent) opening of ethics, origin of morality & immorality; no ethics w/out other, detour, simulation, differance, absence, writing

OG.content: “l’abîme, c’est le creux qui peut rester ouvert entre la défaillance de la nature et le retard du supplément” [abyss as delay, hollow, open]
OG.linkedContent: “l’abîme, c’est le creux qui peut rester ouvert entre la défaillance de la nature et le retard du supplément” [abyss as delay, hollow, open]

OG.content: writing/double opens desire and re-gardent la jouissance—Rousseau searches for un salut (haven) dans l’écriture
OG.linkedContent: writing/double opens desire and re-gardent la jouissance—Rousseau searches for un salut (haven) dans l’écriture

EU.content: philosophy finds itself inscribed w/in space it can’t order, opens to an other not even its other > in a tympanum as little Hegelian as possible
EU.linkedContent: philosophy finds itself inscribed w/in space it can’t order, opens to an other not even its other > in a tympanum as little Hegelian as possible

EU.content: [CIPH] no preinterpretation, “thinking” as what questions philosophy > indeterminate opening (experimental incursions in unexplored areas)
EU.linkedContent: [CIPH] no preinterpretation, “thinking” as what questions philosophy > indeterminate opening (experimental incursions in unexplored areas)

EU.content: “thinking” proceeds to limits of these unavoidable words of legitimation: art, science, philosophy, technique, practice, law, etc.
EU.linkedContent: “thinking” proceeds to limits of these unavoidable words of legitimation: art, science, philosophy, technique, practice, law, etc.

EU.content: permanent opening: never suture w/ assurance (tranquility) of doctrine or dogma
EU.linkedContent: permanent opening: never suture w/ assurance (tranquility) of doctrine or dogma

FV.content: when Lacan sees “triads,” he misses a scene, there’s always supplement of square > square’s opening complicates the calculations
FV.linkedContent: when Lacan sees “triads,” he misses a scene, there’s always supplement of square > square’s opening complicates the calculations

FV.content: letter found “in” the text which escapes, from 4th side, eyes of Dupin/analyst [letter not found in sealed interior of Poe’s tale, not assignable lack, definable hole]
FV.linkedContent: letter found “in” the text which escapes, from 4th side, eyes of Dupin/analyst [letter not found in sealed interior of Poe’s tale, not assignable lack, definable hole]

FV.content: the text The Purloined Letter: the open, the very open, letter that is fiction
FV.linkedContent: the text The Purloined Letter: the open, the very open, letter that is fiction
